effects: Cantrips known: Mage Hand plus 2 wizard cantrips (gain 1 more at Rogue level 10).
Prepared spells: see the Arcane Trickster Spellcasting table (start with 3 level 1 wizard spells).
Spell slots: see the Arcane Trickster Spellcasting table.
Whenever you gain a Rogue level, you can replace one cantrip (except Mage Hand) with another Wizard cantrip.
Whenever you gain a Rogue level, you can replace one prepared spell with another Wizard spell for which you have spell slots.
limits: You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

effects: You can cast it as a bonus action and make the spectral hand invisible.
You can control the hand as a bonus action, and through it you can make Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks.

feature_defs.trigger: when you have the Invisible condition and cast a spell on a creature
effects: The creature has disadvantage on any saving throw it makes against the spell on the same turn.

feature_defs.trigger: when you use the Trip option of Cunning Strike
effects: You can also use that option on another creature within 5 feet of your Mage Hand.

feature_defs.trigger: immediately after a creature casts a spell that targets you or includes you in its area
effects: You force the creature to make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC.
On a failed save, you negate the spell’s effect against you and steal the spell if it is level 1+ and of a level you can cast (it doesn’t need to be a wizard spell).
For the next 8 hours, you have the spell prepared; the creature can’t cast it until the 8 hours have passed.
limits: Once you steal a spell with this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.
notes: saving throw DC formula noted in effects
